name: places/ChIJs7MkOL5fwokRCryZ7eVpse4
adrFormatAddress: 10 Halletts Point, Queens, NY 11102, USA

originalText.text: I absolutely LOVE living at Halletts Point. The staff is fantastic - maintenance is fast, the porters are great, every concierge knows my name and welcomes me home daily! As a single female and native NYer I feel incredibly safe here (not something I felt most other places I looked at.) Use some street smarts and common sense walking around the neighborhood and you’ll be fine. My dogs are welcome which is a huge stress-reliever. Yes, there’s construction noise, like everywhere in NYC, but it’s not at all intolerable and this is still one of the quietest areas you’ll find this close to the city. The ferry is super convenient for me working on the UES. There are also several buses and a free shuttle to the subway, restaurants, shopping, etc. They have some pretty cool monthly events like wine tastings, dance classes, barbecues, etc. Also there’s a grocery store downstairs and an urgent care AND wine shop a block away. Need I say more?

originalText.text: Beautiful building with fantastic water views outside of the hustle. I love all the amenities here, the 4 the floor BBQ terrace has beautiful view of the city. The staffs are nice and keep the whole building nice and clean. The only down side is it’s far away from the subway station and the bus seldom follow its schedule. Although the building has its own shuttle, it’s barely on time, which makes the commute not so easy. It’s several block away from the Astoria park, where you can enjoy the sunset and exercising. The neighborhood here is a mix, during the day time is fine, but needs to be alert during the night time in certain area. But overall, it’s a nice place to stay.

originalText.text: The apartments and the building staff are nice, however ever since we moved in a month ago, there has been a horrible strong marijuana smell that comes into our apartment vent and in the hallways that makes me give this building a 1 star review. This is a daily occurrence and the smell is so bad it’s going into our bed sheets and clothes. It’s ridiculous and just unacceptable that a building that has a supposedly “strict” no-smoking policy is allowing this to happen. And considering the marketing they use to promote these apartments as high-end! We’ve complained and contacted management several times, yet the whole month nothing has been done to stop it. So unless you smoke marijuana, I wouldn’t recommend living here.

originalText.text:
Everything inside the building is perfect but do take the following factors into account:
1. Construction site
2. If you don’t have a car, you rely on buses
3. units that are facing the garden and in low level should consider garden party and grill

originalText.text: Been living at 10 Halletts Point for almost 2 years now This has been my favorite home after living in NYC for over 10 years.
